title: Design Day in SF
name: Design Day in SF
description:
A Map by Ruparc

San Francisco has the distinction of being one of the most &quot;designerly&quot; cities in the world. From hip stores in the city to the product design consultancies on the Peninsula, it has a distinct tradition of creative flair that can't be beat.

Join us for a photography and design day as we tour across museums, cafes, speciality and book stores. 

Pls check our comments section for the sources of this information

properties.name: Alessi store
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc 424 Sutter Street San FranciscoThe fundamental concept was to handle Alessi objects as if they were fairy-tale characters, each with its own story and traits, and a desire to transmit joy and aesthetic energy. The interior design of these stores, which we have created in a number of cities around the world, combines the excitement of fairy tales with the effects of a underkammer, the "Wonder Chamber" popular during the Renaissance and Baroque. Tel. 415.434.0403

properties.name: Atys Design
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc 2149- B Union Street San Francisco CA 94123It\'s a speck of a store pushed back off of the street in a little courtyard. There\'s more design crammed in here than stores four times the size.

properties.name: Cell Space
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc2050 Bryant Street, San Francisco, CA 94110 Cellspace is one of the more unique places in the city. It houses a variety of artists in one giant warehouse and they often host unique events.

properties.name: Karikter
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc418 Sutter Street San Francisco, CA 94108Karikter, near Union Square, is one of the only stores where you can find that European character t-shirt you always craved. They specialize in Tintin, Babar, Asterix and Le Petit Prince. tel: 1 415 434 1120

properties.name: Limn
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc 290 Townsend Street San Francisco, CA 94107Worth a trip of its own is LIMN on Townsend Street in SOMA. This is a product designer\'s heaven. They have it all. Furniture, lighting, tableware, equipment. Probably the best design store in the country. Period. T (415) 543-5466 Hours: M - F 9:30am - 6:00pm Weekend 11:00am - 6:00pm

properties.name: SFMOMA
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc  151 Third Street San Francisco, CA 94103Telephone: 415.357.4000 (between Mission and Howard Streets) Museum Summer Hours (Memorial Day through Labor Day) Monday – Tuesday 10:00 a.m. - 5:45 p.m. Wednesday CLOSED Thursday 10:00 a.m. - 8:45 p.m. Friday – Sunday 10:00 a.m. - 5:45 p.m. Museum Hours Monday – Tuesday 11:00 a.m. - 5:45 p.m. Wednesday CLOSED Thursday 11:00 a.m. - 8:45 p.m. Friday – Sunday 11:00 a.m. - 5:45 p.m.

properties.name: San Francisco Design Center
properties.description: Posted by RuparcTwo Henry Adams Street, Suite 450 San Francisco, CA 94103 the San Francisco Design Center houses over 100 home furnishing distributors representing 2000 manufacturers. Great place to browse. Nearby are a number of warehouse stores which are worth checking out as well. San Francisco Design Center [SFDC] is the West\'s best destination for fine home furnishings and accessories. SFDC is free and open to the public for browsing Monday through Friday, 9am to 5pm. Complimentary designer-led tours are available through the The Design Studio.

properties.name: The Hosfelt Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc  430 Clementina Street San Francisco, CA 94103 A Gallery representing represents artists which are on the edge between art and technology.

properties.name: William Stout Architectural Books
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc 804 Montgomery Street San Francisco, CA 94133For books, you\'ll need to go to William Stout Architectural Books near the Transamerica Pyramid. If you like design, be prepared to spend a few hours here.

properties.name: Zinc Details
properties.description: Posted by Ruparc1905 Fillmore Street / Bush + Pine San Francisco, CA 94115t. 415. 776. 2100 Hours Monday - Saturday: 11am - 7pm Sunday: 12 pm - 6 pm
